intro: Lippia cymosa, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and clusters of small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Lippia cymosa is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
